comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: 000z on August 23, 2022, 01:54:44 PMwhy i am selling? some people want to use leverage without having to worry about getting problems with liquidations, thats why i am making accounts for people dont have to worry How will the accounts made by you will have no liquidations ? Yes, people may be interested to buy accounts if they want to do some illegal activities or avoid their personal KYC but there is no way you can nullify liquidations in your trades.By the way, buying exchanges account is risky business and should be avoided.

comments.author: 000z
comments.body: How will the accounts made by you will have no liquidations ?  A: I can answer that in telegram. ( @z000z2222z )Yes, people may be interested to buy accounts if they want to do some illegal activities or avoid their personal KYC but there is no way you can nullify liquidations in your trades.  A: I think I used the wrong words, ofc u can get liquidated, but once u get liquidated u just leave the account so u wont get in debt.By the way, buying exchanges account is risky business and should be avoided.A: true, well, I might delete the thread, I saw the rules and selling account isnt the thing in this forumThanks!

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: 000z on August 23, 2022, 08:09:08 PMor negative. in sum exchanges u can get negative. Which exchange can let your account go to negative... lol. Read more about the insurance fund and auto deleveraging (ADL)You are offering a banned service. You may get banned any time soonQuote from: theymos on August 07, 2019, 07:06:24 PMTrading the accounts of these services is not allowed. Report anyone selling them. Newbies will be permanently banned; established members may be given warnings before being banned, but the relevant posts will be deleted.AWSN26UpworkServices are added to this list when we come to believe that essentially no trades of such accounts are following our rules, which prohibit for example selling hacked accounts, accounts requiring KYC info, accounts created using stolen identities, etc. If you have a really strong argument for how you're selling these accounts without violating our rules, create a topic in Meta explaining in detail, and we may consider either removing the service from this list or giving you a one-time exemption.This list only applies to sales of accounts, not invites, codes, etc., though sales of the latter items must still follow our usual rules.
